featured.text: Finally, as predicted, snakes captured during the dry season contained significantly less body water than those scooped up in the rainy season.
The additional tines made diners less likely to drop food, and the curved tines served as a scoop so people did not have to constantly switch to a spoon while eating.
They could be used to scoop food as well.

definition.zh_def: 舀取或挖取的動作或工具，通常用於盛裝食物或其他物質。
definition.en_def: A tool or action used to lift or move a substance, often food, from one place to another.
definition.example: She used a scoop to serve the ice cream into the bowls.
